section.title: lms.djangoapps.instructor.access module
section.paragraph: Access control operations for use by instructor APIs.
Does not include any access control, be sure to check access before calling.

definition_list_item.term: TO DO sync instructor and staff flags

definition.paragraph: {instructor: true, staff: false} {instructor: true, staff: true}

desc_content.paragraph: Allow user access to course modification.
level is one of [instructor, staff, beta]
Returns True if the user is a beta tester in this course, and False if not
List users who have level access.
level is in [instructor, staff, beta] for standard courses. There could be other levels specific to the course. If there is no Group for that course-level, returns an empty list
Revoke access from user to course modification.
level is one of [instructor, staff, beta]
Change forum access of user.
rolename is one of [FORUM_ROLE_ADMINISTRATOR, FORUM_ROLE_MODERATOR, FORUM_ROLE_COMMUNITY_TA] action is one of [allow, revoke]
if action is bad, raises ValueError if rolename does not exist, raises Role.DoesNotExist
Bases: AppConfig
Application Configuration for Instructor.
Override this method in subclasses to run code when Django starts.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.instructor.enrollment module
section.paragraph: Enrollment operations for use by instructor APIs.
Does not include any access control, be sure to check access before calling.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: object
Store the complete enrollment state of an email in a class

definition.paragraph: user: False, enrollment: False, allowed: True, auto_enroll: True,

desc_content.paragraph: Enroll a student by email.
student_email is students emails e.g. foo@bar.com auto_enroll determines what is put in CourseEnrollmentAllowed.auto_enroll

block_quote.paragraph: if auto_enroll is set, then when the email registers, they will be enrolled in the course automatically.

desc_content.paragraph: message_students determines if student should be notified of action by email or push message. message_params parameters used while parsing message templates (a dict). language is the language used to render the email.

definition.paragraph: representing state before and after the action.

desc_content.paragraph: Generate parameters used when parsing email templates.
auto_enroll is a flag for auto enrolling non-registered students: (a boolean) Returns a dict of parameters
Return the rendered subject and message with the appropriate parameters.
Return the language most appropriate for writing emails to user. Returns None if the preference has not been set, or if the user does not exist.
Render a mail subject and message templates using the parameters from param_dict and the given language. If language is None, the platform default language is used.
Returns two strings that correspond to the rendered, translated email subject and message.
Reset student attempts for a problem. Optionally deletes all student state for the specified problem.
In the previous instructor dashboard it was possible to modify/delete modules that were not problems. That has been disabled for safety.

student is a User problem_to_reset is the name of a problem e.g. L2Node1. To build the module_state_key problem/ and course information will be appended to problem_to_reset. delete_module: Instead of resetting attempts, delete the learners StudentModule emit_signals_and_events: If this is False, dont fire django signals or emit events. This is intended for

block_quote.paragraph: the case where we are calling this function many times, and want to handle the signalling and eventing at a bulk level rather than firing every individual call to this function

list_item.paragraph: StudentModule.DoesNotExist could not load the student module.
submissions.SubmissionError unexpected error occurred while resetting the score in the submissions API.

desc_content.paragraph: Send an email to a user added or removed as a beta tester.
action is one of add or remove user is the User affected message_params parameters used while parsing email templates (a dict).
Construct the email using templates and then send it. student is the students email address (a str),
param_dict is a dict with keys [

block_quote.paragraph: site_name: name given to edX instance (a str) registration_url: url for registration (a str) display_name : display name of a course (a str) course_id: id of course (a str) auto_enroll: user input option (a str) course_url: url of course (a str) user_id: LMS user ID of student (an int) - None if unknown email_address: email of student (a str) full_name: student full name (a str) message_type: type of email to send and template to use (a str) is_shib_course: (a boolean)

desc_content.paragraph: language is the language used to render the email. If None the language of the currently-logged in user (that is, the user sending the email) will be used.
Returns a boolean indicating whether the email was sent successfully.
Unenroll a student by email.

student_email is students emails e.g. foo@bar.com message_students determines if student should be notified of action by email or push message. message_params parameters used while parsing email templates (a dict). language is the language used to render the email.

definition.paragraph: representing state before and after the action.

desc_content.paragraph: Used to return whether course has Shibboleth as the enrollment domain
Returns a boolean indicating if Shibboleth authentication is set for this course.
exam completion event from the event bus
exam reset event from the event bus

section.title: lms.djangoapps.instructor.message_types module
section.paragraph: ACE message types for the instructor module.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: BaseMessageType
A message for registering and inviting learners into a course.
This message includes username and password.
Bases: BaseMessageType
A message for course beta testers when theyre invited.
Bases: BaseMessageType
A message for _unregistered_ learners who received an invitation to a course.
Bases: BaseMessageType
A message for _unregistered_ learners who had their invitation to a course cancelled.
Bases: BaseMessageType
A message for _registered_ learners who have been both invited and enrolled to a course.
Bases: BaseMessageType
A message for _registered_ learners who have been unenrolled from a course.
Bases: BaseMessageType
A message for course beta testers when theyre removed.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.instructor.permissions module
section.paragraph: Permissions for the instructor dashboard and associated actions

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: BasePermission
Generic permissions
Return True if permission is granted, False otherwise.
Bases: object

Instructor service for deleting the students attempt(s) of an exam. This service has been created for the edx_proctorings dependency injection to cater for a requirement where edx_proctoring needs to call into edx-platforms functions to delete the students existing answers, grades and attempt counts if there had been an earlier attempt.
This service also contains utility functions to check if a user is course staff, send notifications related to proctored exam attempts, and retrieve a course teams proctoring escalation email.
Calls the update_exam_completion_task, marking the exam as complete.

The task submits all completable xblocks inside of the content_id block to the Completion Service to mark them as complete. One use case of this function is for special exams (timed/proctored) where regardless of submission status on individual problems, we want to mark the entire exam as complete when the exam is finished.

definition.paragraph: user_identifier (str): username or email of a user content_id (str): the block key for a piece of content

desc_content.paragraph: Deletes student state for a problem. requesting_user may be kept as an audit trail.

definition_list_item.term: Takes some of the following query parameters

list_item.paragraph: student_identifier is an email or username
content_id is a url-name of a problem
course_id is the id for the course

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the proctoring escalation email for a course, or None if not given.
Example arguments: * course_id (String): block-v1:edX+DemoX+Demo_Course
Returns True if the user is the course staff else Returns False

Creates a Zendesk ticket for an exam attempt review from the proctoring system. Currently, it sends notifications for Suspicious status, but additional statuses can be supported by adding to the notify_support_for_status list in edx_proctoring/backends/software_secure.py The notifications can be disabled by disabling the Create Zendesk Tickets For Suspicious Proctored Exam Attempts setting in the courses Advanced settings.

desc_content.paragraph: check if data download v2 is enabled.
